title.narrative: Strengthening the Capacities of the Government of Côte d’Ivoire to Effectively Manage Labour Migration along the Côte d’Ivoire – Tunisia Migration Corridor

description.narrative: Côte d’Ivoire has historically been characterized as a destination country for migrants within the West African region. Yet, in recent years, the country has witnessed an increase in out-bound migration of Ivorian citizens via both regular and irregular migratory routes to Europe, North Africa and the Gulf countries, to a lesser extent. Although the Government of Côte d’Ivoire has made measurable progress in the field of migration management in recent years, broader migration management outcomes could be reached through a comprehensive approach that considers the various aspects of movements along the migration corridor between the two countries. In light of the above, this project aims to strengthen the capacity of the Government of Côte d’Ivoire to effectively manage labour migration along the Côte d’Ivoire – Tunisia corridor through the endorsement of a joint action plan on labour migration management. This will be possible through: •Development of a comprehensive and gender-sensitive Labour Market Assessment (LMA) for Tunisia and Côte d’Ivoire;•Strengthening of bilateral cooperation between Ivorian and Tunisian authorities on labour mobility and human development;•Enhancement of public and private actors’ knowledge on pre-departure orientation in both countries;•Increase cooperation between relevant actors in Côte d’Ivoire and Tunisia on tertiary education.

mailing-address.narrative: Cocody les II Plateaux Vallon Lot N° 1616 Rue L107, Abidjan, Cote d'Ivoire

sector.narrative: Facilitation of orderly, safe, regular and responsible migration and mobility

policy-marker.narrative: Project with sufficient inclusion of gender issues (mainstreamed)
